title: E141: State of Series A's, VC dry powder, IPO window opens + more with Bill Gurley & Brad Gerstner
summary: In a podcast featuring Brad Gerstner and Bill Gurley, the two discuss their current projects and offer advice on writing a business book. They recommend including personal anecdotes to make the book more engaging and discuss the impact of biographies on their careers. The video transcript then moves on to recommendations for biographies and films related to business and personal growth, including books such as "Man in the Arena" and "On Writing," as well as the films of Akira Kurosawa. The VC market has stabilized for new fundraising, but there may be a one to two year period of distress for companies that raised in the peak of 2020-2021. The video also discusses misconceptions about dry powder in the VC industry and the impact of reduced commitments on venture capital funds. The software industry is experiencing a recession, and startups are renewing contracts at significantly lower values. The video ends with a discussion on the tragic Maui wildfires and extreme temperatures, with a focus on the impact of global warming and the challenges of addressing climate change.
